channel.title: Creativebug - Art + Design
channel.description: Here youâ€™ll find online art classes, with classic instruction in drawing, watercolor, and calligraphy as well as exploratory classes on art journaling, sketchbooking, and surface design. Be sure to browse our textile category, too, with loads of instruction on dyeing, weaving and fabric design.

item.title: Carved Eraser Stamps: 1/17/17
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Courtney demonstrates how to transfer an image onto an eraser and then carve it to make a stamp. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on January 17, 2017.

item.title: Oil Pastel Exploration: 1/3/17
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Courtney demystifies working with oil pastels and teaches some cool techniques along the way. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on January 3, 2017.

item.title: Creative Boot Camp - Six Exercises to Spark Artistic Discovery
item.author: Lisa Congdon
item.description:
Jumpstart your artistic practice with six weeks of creativity exercises taught by Lisa Congdon. Using a variety of Lisa's favorite art supplies and tried-and-true processes, learn how to use Microns, oil sticks, paints and collage to take a fresh look at shape, line and color. These exercises allow you to "get loose" and enjoy the process without overthinking the outcome. You’ll also learn how to work with color, use collage to respond to your in-progress artwork, and go outside to gather inspiration from your surroundings. Unlike Lisa's other classes, this series focuses less on specific projects and dives deeply into the artistic process to help you develop your own creative voice.

Make sure to share your artwork in our class galleries and on Instagram #cbugbootcamp

item.title: Q&A With Dawn DeVries Sokol: 12/15/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Join Courtney for a Q&A with Dawn DeVries Sokol as she introduces her Holiday Art Journaling class. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on December 15, 2016.

item.title: Pinecone People: 12/13/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Courtney shows how to make vintage-inspired pinecone people holiday decor. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on December 13, 2016.

item.title: Creating a Mixed-Paper Sketchbook
item.author: Pam Garrison
item.description: A sketchbook featuring a range of fun and colorful papers makes the perfect background for on-the-go sketching, journaling or list making. Learn how to create a mixed-paper sketchbook by gathering together interesting papers and sewing them together with an easy pamphlet stitch. Pam Garrison also shows a few of her own mixed-paper sketchbooks, featuring solid-colored papers, patterned papers and pages on which she’s already drawn or painted.

item.title: Paper-Punched Gift Tags: 12/8/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Learn how to make painted paper-punched gift tags to spruce up any gift. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on December 8, 2016.

item.title: Holiday Art Journaling
item.author: Dawn DeVries Sokol
item.description: Keep your creativity going strong during one of the busiest seasons of the year by making a holiday art journal. Dawn DeVries Sokol shows how to transform everyday ephemera into collage fodder for your pages, working with embellishments, images and lettering to create holiday themed pages without a fuss. Every week, Dawn provides new themes to focus on, encouraging you to take a few moments a day to sit down and celebrate the season. Be sure to share what you make in our class galleries, or on Instagram #cbdrawaday #cbugholiday #creativebug !

item.title: Hand-Stamped Round Coin Purse
item.author: Jen Hewett
item.description: Create one-of-a-kind coin purses with this simple tutorial. Printmaker Jen Hewett shows you how to create custom stamps and print fabric with geometric designs. You will then learn how to assemble the bag by sewing the curved edges, adding a lining, and finishing with a decorative zipper pull.

item.title: Illustrative Painting with Gouache
item.author: Jennifer Orkin Lewis
item.description: Learn how Jennifer Orkin Lewis (also known as August Wren) uses gouache to create vibrant illustrations. Jennifer’s paintings are full of color and movement, and in this 3-part series, you’ll learn how to approach painting in her lively style. The class begins with a lesson on mixing colors and painting everyday objects. Once you’ve had a chance to practice your brushstrokes, you’ll learn how to paint florals and create stylized lettering.

item.title: Daily Creativity Challenge
item.author: Creativebug
item.description: The team at Creativebug is surrounded by inspiration every day, but even the most prolific amongst us needs a jumpstart now and then. We asked members of our staff to share their go-to tips for finding creativity when the well has run dry. Their answers are as versatile as the artists themselves. Each day this month, members of our staff will be sharing their favorite ways to stoke the creative fires. Join us for a month of painting, drawing, journaling, organizing, upcycling, beautifying, and so much more.

item.title: Drawing and Chatting with Lisa Congdon: 9/29/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Lisa Congdon and Courtney Cerruti doodle, talk art, drink tea, and answer questions. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on September 29, 2016.

item.title: Watercolor FAQs with Yao Cheng
item.author: Yao Cheng
item.description: Have you ever wanted to know more about Yao Cheng’s creative process? Us too! We sat down with Yao in her gorgeous light-filled studio to have a chat about some frequently asked questions. In this interview-style class, Yao discusses her approach to everything from composition to confidence – and she even shares advice for those who want to digitize their paintings but don’t know where to begin. We hope her answers illuminate your path as a watercolor artist and inspire you to keep practicing.

item.title: Playing with Surface Design
item.author: Courtney Cerruti
item.description: You don’t need a background in art to create beautiful surface designs on paper and fabric. Join Courtney Cerruti as she leads you through a series of exercises from her book Playing with Surface Design: Modern Techniques for Painting, Stamping, Printing and More. In this three-part series, you will learn creative ways to play with paint, markers, and stamps, plus a simple form of printmaking called monoprinting. Combine all of these lessons to create layered, textural surfaces that can be used as cards, wrapping paper, fabric yardage and more.

item.title: Playing with Surface Design
item.author: Courtney Cerruti
item.description: You don’t need a background in art to create beautiful surface designs on paper and fabric. Join Courtney Cerruti as she leads you through a series of exercises from her book Playing with Surface Design: Modern Techniques for Painting, Stamping, Printing and More. item.title: Hand-Stamped Tote Bag with Leather Handles
item.author: Jen Hewett
item.description: This adorable handbag is the ultimate personalized accessory. Printmaker and surface designer, Jen Hewett, shows you how to create simple stamps and print custom fabric. She then shows you how easy it is to sew a tote using your hand-stamped fabric. French seams and riveted leather handles create a professional finishing touch.

item.title: Bubble Prints: 8/23/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Faith Hale shows us how to make super cool prints using bubbles and food coloring or ink. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on August 23, 2016.

item.title: Doodling on an iPad
item.author: Pam Garrison
item.description: When it comes to doodling, paper and pen aren’t your only options. Pam Garrison demonstrates how she likes to use her iPad to doodle using the free app “Paper” by FiftyThree and talks about how it inspires her process. You really don’t have to be a tech expert to use technology for your creations.

item.title: Stenciled Wall Decor and Doodled Shoes: 8/18/16
item.author: CBTV Live
item.description: Learn how to make stenciled wall décor and doodled shoes with supplies from Michaels Stores. This video originally appeared on Facebook Live on August 18, 2016.

item.title: Painting Watercolor Pet Portraits
item.author: Christine Aria Hostetler
item.description: You don't have to be a drawing or painting expert to create a beautiful watercolor pet portrait. Artist and illustrator, Christine Aria, shares her fail-proof technique for painting furry friends. Learn how to select a photo of your pet that will translate into a successful final painting, and then transfer the image to your paper to create a framework for painting. Christine shares copious tips for creating a custom palette and painting realistic details with layers of color. This class is an ideal deep-dive for anyone who wants a fearless introduction to painting animal forms.

item.title: Daily Drawing Challenge: 31 Art Journal Prompts with Dawn DeVries Sokol
item.author: Dawn DeVries Sokol
item.description: Join professional doodler, Dawn DeVries Sokol, for a month of art journaling inspiration. Every day for 31 days, Dawn provides prompts to get you making art that is fun, intuitive and totally you. Learn how to create backgrounds, respond to prompts, and add embellishments, lettering and collage along the way. Stay loose and respond to whatever strikes you in the moment without the pressure of having to create a “finished” piece of art.

item.title: Intuitive Painting
item.author: Flora Bowley
item.description: Immerse yourself in the world of abstract artist and intuitive painter Flora Bowley.  In this epic three-part course, you'll not only learn how to observe the world around you and tap into your creative intuition, but also how to take a brave, curious and open-minded approach to painting with acrylics.

item.title: Intuitive Painting
item.author: Flora Bowley
item.description: Immerse yourself in the world of abstract artist and intuitive painter Flora Bowley.  In this epic three-part course, you'll not only learn how to observe the world around you and tap into your creative intuition, but also how to take a brave, curious and open-minded approach to painting with acrylics.

item.title: Intuitive Painting
item.author: Flora Bowley
item.description: Immerse yourself in the world of abstract artist and intuitive painter Flora Bowley.  In this epic three-part course, you'll not only learn how to observe the world around you and tap into your creative intuition, but also how to take a brave, curious and open-minded approach to painting with acrylics.

item.title: Daily Drawing Challenge: 31 Pattern Motifs with Courtney Cerruti
item.author: Courtney Cerruti
item.description: Go beyond drawing individual objects with our daily pattern motif drawing challenge. In this 31-part class, Courtney Cerruti shares easy ideas for approaching surface design, opening new avenues of imagination and creativity. To keep things simple, Courtney works exclusively on index cards using brush markers. From foods to animals to abstract geometric shapes, you’ll explore fun, loose variations on a different pattern motif every day for a month. When you’re all done, the index cards are the perfect size to mail to friends (or us!).

item.title: Natural Dyeing with Indigo
item.author: A Verb for Keeping Warm
item.description: Indigo blue is like no other blue. With natural dyeing expert, Kristine Vejar, learn how to create an indigo vat in your kitchen or backyard. Using a plain cotton bandana, Kristine shows you how to create several resist designs using clothespins and simple folding techniques. You'll learn how to create an Indigo “Mother” and vat in order to create limitless beautiful and unique indigo-dyed textiles.

item.title: Creative Doodling
item.author: Pam Garrison
item.description: Stretch your creative muscles and join Pam Garrison in this fun four-part celebration of doodling. In Pam’s classes, mistakes are embraced and you are encouraged to think outside of the box as you play with your designs and develop an expanded visual vocabulary. The great thing about doodling is that anyone can do it, nearly anywhere! If you already doodle while on the phone, in meetings or in the margins of your notebook, Pam’s class will help you take your creative doodling practice even further.
